criteria: Identification of Symbols and Key Terms
descriptions: The student does not identify any symbols or key terms in the text.
The student identifies a few symbols or key terms, but the identifications are largely inaccurate or irrelevant.
The student identifies some symbols and key terms with limited accuracy. Understanding of their meaning within the text is superficial.
The student identifies most symbols and key terms correctly. The student demonstrates a basic understanding of their meaning within the text.
The student correctly identifies nearly all symbols and key terms. The student demonstrates a clear understanding of their meaning within the specific scientific or technical context.

The student accurately and comprehensively identifies all symbols and key terms, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of their nuanced meanings and implications within the scientific or technical context. Demonstrates the ability to apply understanding in novel contexts.
The student does not demonstrate understanding of any domain-specific vocabulary.
The student attempts to define domain-specific vocabulary, but definitions are largely incorrect or missing.
The student provides partially correct definitions for some domain-specific vocabulary but struggles with applying these definitions to the text.
The student demonstrates a generally accurate understanding of domain-specific vocabulary and applies it to the text with some success.
The student demonstrates a strong understanding of domain-specific vocabulary and effectively applies it to interpret the text accurately.
The student exhibits mastery of domain-specific vocabulary, using it seamlessly to interpret complex information and draw insightful conclusions relevant to the scientific or technical field.
The student fails to apply any identified terms or symbols to the scientific or technical context.
The student attempts to apply identified terms and symbols to the context, but the application is illogical or irrelevant.
The student shows a limited ability to connect the meaning of terms and symbols to the broader context of the scientific or technical text.
The student makes reasonable connections between the terms/symbols and the context, enhancing their interpretation of the text.
The student skillfully applies the meaning of terms and symbols to enhance comprehension and draw conclusions about the scientific or technical context.

The student demonstrates an exceptional ability to use the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific vocabulary to fully comprehend and analyze the scientific or technical context, synthesizing information to form sophisticated insights.
